page.title: 18The School Fete
page.content: The fete was held on Saturday 29 June which was a warm day after a week of rain.There were 20 stalls.The main one was the bottle tombola.There was a Treasure Hunt,a Bookstall,a Cakestall and a stall selling hot dogs.Visitors could fish for bottles,ride mini motor bikes and get apples out of a bowl of water with their teeth. The vistors were entertained by a barrel organ,a Punch and Judy show and the South Molton Silver Band.There was also skittles,steam engine rides and pony rides.THE DRAW which raised the most money had some very good prizes like a holiday in Paris,or a Â£250 travel voucher,a gallon bottle of whisky and a snooker cue personally endorsed by Steve Davis. The fete and the draw raised over Â£2000.
